Difficulty breathing; swelling in face, neck, throat and tongue; swelling in face, neck, throat and tongue; swelling in face, neck, throat and tongue; swelling in face, neck, throat and tongue; elevated heart rate; rash on face, neck and chest; Enlarged lymph nodes; dizziness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient non-pregnant patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL8982), via an unspecified route of administration on right arm on 09Feb2021 at 15:45 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation in the hospital. Medical history was none. The patient had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medications included furosemide (LASIX) and other blood pressure meds (unspecified). The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient received other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 09Feb2021, at 16:45 the patient had difficulty breathing, swelling in face, neck, throat and tongue, elevated heart rate, rash on face, neck and chest, enlarged lymph nodes and dizziness. The patient assessed the events as non-serious. Steroids, Benadryl, Pepcid, antibiotics were given as treatment in response to the adverse events. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, patient was not tested for COVID-19. The patient was recovering from the events.

59 2021-03-03 throat tightness her hands swelling and tightness; her hands swelling and tightness; underside of the forearms had a ... Read more
Close
her hands swelling and tightness; her hands swelling and tightness; underside of the forearms had a lacey honeycomb pattern of red with white blotches; her cheeks were bright red; top of her hands to her wrist and lower arms were very red; felt light headed/faint and dizzy; tightness in her chest; the tightness that she felt the day before was in her lungs or throat; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Physician reporting for his/her sister. A 59-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2) via an unspecified route of administration at single dose in Jan2021 (12 days before reporting) for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included Hashimoto's autoimmune disease, enlarged thyroid, goitre. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. In Jan2021, as soon as she got the injection, the patient felt both her hands swelling and tightness, underside of the forearms had a lacey honeycomb pattern of red with white blotches, top of her hands to her wrist and lower arms were very red, her cheeks were bright red, felt light headed/faint and dizzy, tightness in her chest and thought it was her heart. She was monitored for an hour but was told it probably wasn't an allergic reaction. Symptoms began to fade at that time. Next day she felt good and thought the tightness that she felt the day before was in her lungs or throat. The outcome of events was recovering. The events were reported as non serious. Reporter was referred to HCP or vaccination provider to determine if this was a severe allergic reaction and if she should receive the second dose of the vaccine. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

headache; Asthmatic Cough; Taste metallic/ tongue felt metallic; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), first dose via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 04Feb2021 11:40 (Batch/Lot Number: EL9261) (at 59-year-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included Hypertension, Gout, Allergy. She clarified that she is allergic to NSAIDS and as well has environmental and food allergies. She clarifies that her Allergies do change from time to time, she is allergic to fragrances. Wheat bothered her before, but not anymore, thats what she meant by her allergies changes. Concomitant medications was not reported. She did not take any NSAIDS because they made her wheeze. She only had her regular medication that she takes on routine schedule. The patient previously took ibuprofen and allergy. She is Allergic to ibuprofen and had an asthmatic cough after it. The patient had first dose of the Pfizer covid vaccine a week ago Thursday, she has a question. She had that dose, and when she had the injection was fine, she did have a metallic taste in mouth (04Feb2021) but it was no issue. Then she woke up coughing on Friday (05Feb2021) and Saturday (06Feb2021), it was like an asthmatic feeling, she will feel it time to time when having an allergy to something. She had headache on Sunday (07Feb2021). She didnt know if that was an indication to a problem with the vaccine. She wanted to know if it was safe to take the second dose. It was clarified that the metallic taste started 10 minutes after the injections. The Asthmatic Cough started on Friday 05Feb2021, she woke up coughing. She clarified that the metallic taste only last just up to that afternoon. The asthmatic cough subsided Saturday. She experienced a lot of coughing on Friday, then a little on Saturday and that was last day. She was just concerned about it, she did not want it to get worse. She does not normally have metallic taste in her mouth, so she thought it could be related but she really doesn't know. She didn't know if the asthmatic cough is related, it could even be a coincidence, she hasn't experienced something like this in a year. She just wants to know if she should get the second dose. It stated that her second dose is schedule for 25Feb2021 at 11:40AM. The outcome of the event Taste metallic/ tongue felt metallic was recovered on 04Feb2021, Asthmatic Cough was recovered on 06Feb2021, and headache was unknown.
59 2021-03-21 throat swelling On March 5th (day 11 after vaccine) I awoke with red rash/hives on palms of both hands and elbows an... Read more
Close
On March 5th (day 11 after vaccine) I awoke with red rash/hives on palms of both hands and elbows and underside of forearms and upper left thigh. The rash got worse each day spreading all over my body causing me to seek medical treatment first with primary doctor who gave me prednisone pack and injection and then my local emergency room (twice) due to swelling of throat and tongue. I was given prednisone IV treatment and sent home with a high dose of medication for inflammation and hydroxyzine for itch and famotidine for stomach upset. My doctor got me in to see immunologist for tests and treatment. That doctor took blood and diagnosed me as having a moderate to severe delayed allergic reaction post covid vaccination. My liver had elevated levels of bili-rubin my white blood count was over 16,000 and my skin was cover in red, itchy hives and rash from head to bottoms of my feet for over ten days. I was very sick and miserable.

Family Medicine Cosigned by: MD at 3/23/2021 1:26 PM Expand AllCollapse All COVID VACCINE CLINIC 3/19/2021 Patient: DOB: Date: 3/19/2021 MRN: Subjective Patient is a 59 y.o. female who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for her first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. She was given the Pfizer vaccination in the left deltoid muscle. During her 15 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience heart racing. She denied rash, hives, welts, difficulty breathing, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, throat tightness, hoarseness, stridor, itching, lightheadedness, dizziness, facial swelling, lip swelling and tongue swelling. This provider was notified of patient reaction and she was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to blood pressure abnormality , chest pain, rapid progression of symptoms and respiratory distress. PMH: insignificant. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient denies chills, fever, malaise/fatigue, facial swelling, sore throat, frequent throat clearing, eyes watering, eyes itching, cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath, wheezing, rash, hives, itching of skin, vomiting, abdominal pain, muscle aches, joint pain, dizziness and headaches Heart racing onset 5 minutes after injection. Briefly lasted. Resolved by the time she arrived to the medical bay. NO other symptoms reported. : She ate lunch today. Previous Reactions: none Objective Vitals Vitals: 03/19/21 1412 03/19/21 1422 BP: 137/80 129/65 BP Location: Right arm Pulse: 92 SpO2: 96% Physical Exam Constitutional: General: She is not in acute distress. Appearance: Normal appearance. She is well-developed. She is not diaphoretic. HENT: Mouth/Throat: Mouth: Mucous membranes are moist. Pharynx: Oropharynx is clear. Eyes: Extraocular Movements: Extraocular movements intact. Conjunctiva/sclera: Conjunctivae normal. Pupils: Pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm. Pulses: Normal pulses. Heart sounds: Normal heart sounds. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. No respiratory distress. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds. No wheezing. Skin: General: Skin is warm and dry. Neurological: General: No focal deficit present. Mental Status: She is alert and oriented to person, place, and time. Gait: Gait normal. Psychiatric: Mood and Affect: Mood normal. Behavior: Behavior normal. Thought Content: Thought content normal. Judgment: Judgment normal. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: water and close monitoring until end of her observation time. Follow up response to treatment: excellent. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP. Differential Diagnosis: Vaccine-Related Anxiety (include misc mental health) and Red flag symptoms (CP, SOB, NVD, Visual/Neuro concerns) Possible anxiety flare up. Resolution of symptoms by the time of arrival to bay. Pt feels well. She is appreciative of her care today. APRN Electronically Signed 3/19/2021 2:31 PM

eyes were itchy; hard to breath; lips felt like they were getting puffy and they were bright red; lips felt like they were getting puffy and they were bright red; tongue tingled but didn't swell; heartrate was 112 / heartrate was high; dizzy / lightheaded; vertigo; brain fog; trouble focusing; right arm was itchy and hot where she got the injection; right arm was itchy and hot where she got the injection; had a hard time forming sentences; really tired and sleepy; really tired and sleepy; chills; headache/I felt like my head was kind of throbbing; where the patient's thyroid is was swollen; couldn't really walk; had no balance; ringing in my ears; lost my voice.; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 59-year-old-female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 15Mar2021 (at the age of 59-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included allergic to a lot of medications/ antihistamines. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took diphenhydramine (BENADRYL) and was allergic. On 15Mar2021, within 2-3 minutes of vaccination, the patient's heartrate was 112, she started getting dizzy, lightheaded, and had vertigo. Her oxygen level was okay. On 15Mar2021, the patient also had some brain fog and trouble focusing, the right arm was itchy and hot where she got the injection, her eyes were itchy. The patient was then taken back to lie down. It was hard to breathe and she had to take large deep breaths. Her lips felt like they were getting puffy and they were bright red, she had a hard time forming sentences, was really tired and sleepy, had chills and a headache (felt like her head was kind of throbbing). Also, on 15Mar2021, where the patient's thyroid is was swollen, the patient couldn't really walk and had no balance, had ringing in her ears, her tongue tingled but didn't swell, the walls started moving and she lost her voice. The patient was kept for 2 hours and was almost sent to the ER. The patient brought an epinephrine (EPIPEN) but there was concern administering it because her heartrate was high. The patient questioned whether she should receive the second dose as she almost went into anaphylactic shock after the first dose. The clinical outcome of "right arm was itchy and hot where she got the injection" was resolved on 16Mar2021, of eyes were itchy, hard to breath, lips felt like they were getting puffy and they were bright red, tongue tingled but didn't swell, heartrate was 112 / heartrate was high, dizzy / lightheaded, vertigo, brain fog, trouble focusing, had a hard time forming sentences, really tired and sleepy, chills, headache/I felt like my head was kind of throbbing, where the patient's thyroid is was swollen, couldn't really walk, had no balance, ringing in my ears, lost my voice was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
O2 level was 82-86/ Oxygen level was like 84 or 86 so she was put on oxygen; inflammation in the lower lungs that was rubbing on her diaphragm; Pneumonia; Cough/bad cough/dry cough; Stomach pain/top part of her stomach would hurt/stomach was hurting right at the bottom of her rib cage; gastroenteritis; short of breath; she wasn't breathing deep; feels like she doesn't have any energy; feeling bad; nauseated/felt sick to stomach; ate about half of her breakfast, this lasted for several days, she wouldn't eat much; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's husband) via Pfizer. This consumer reported similar event for two patients. This is the first of two reports. A 59-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EN6206, expiry date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, on 09Mar2021, as single dose, for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included exposure to SARS-COV-2 on 02Mar2021 (reported as "daughter tested positive for COVID on 02Mar2021, patient had been around their daughter and their daughter's husband, they went out to eat with them on the night of 02Mar2021"). Concomitant medication included esomeprazole sodium (NEXIUM) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. On 09Mar2021, the patient received her first shot. About 20 minutes after she took the shot, she started feeling bad and became nauseated/felt sick to stomach. On 09Mar2021, the top part of her stomach would hurt, and she started developing a cough. On 11Mar2021, the patient felt like she doesn't have any energy. The coughing went pretty bad so on 12Mar2021, the patient took a COVID-19 PCR test and it came back negative. The patient kept having a bad cough so then they went to the doctor where they put the patient on prednisone 20 mg and amoxicillin 875 mg on 12Mar2021. On 16Mar2021, the patient went to the family doctor and the doctor put the patient on azithromycin and gave her a steroid shot. Then the patient kept coughing and her stomach was hurting right at the bottom of her rib cage. The patient was never getting better or anything. So, on 18Mar2021, the patient had COVID-19 Virus test where they swabbed her nose and the test came back negative. The patient was taken to the hospital on 19Mar2021 at 11:30 where they did an x-ray of the patient's lungs and her O2 level was 82-86 sitting in the bed (also reported as 84-86 so she was put on oxygen), performed CT scan of her lungs and it looked like there was inflammation in the lower lungs that was rubbing on her diaphragm, and performed Chest CT which determined pneumonia. That night they did another COVID-19 virus test where they went really deep and it came back negative. The patient was admitted to the hospital on the night of 19Mar2021. The patient was given IV ceftriaxone, IV azithromycin, azithromycin (also reported as Zythromax), one breathing treatment, and they said they may have to send the patient home with some oxygen. It was also reported that on 19Mar2021, the patient did really good with coughing, she didn't cough that much. The patient had a dry cough that wasn't productive at all. The patient acted kind of short of breath because she wasn't breathing deep because of the pain in the top part of her stomach, but the reporter doesn't believe it was true shortness of breath. When the patient got out of the hospital on 22Mar2021, she didn't need to come home with the oxygen. The patient's oxygen level is running pretty good at the time of the report, in the lower 90s (Mar2021). The patient was on Decadron 6 mg for 5 days and she's doing pretty good, she still has a little bit of a cough. It was also reported that in Mar2021, the patient only ate about half of her breakfast, this lasted for several days, she wouldn't eat much. The patient pretty much recovered from the nausea. When she ate, it felt like everything would make it to her stomach and just sit there. The emergency room doctor said it could be from gastroenteritis, also they gave the patient several rounds of Protonix. The patient usually takes Nexium every night. The doctor felt that this event could very well be from the vaccine. The reporter asked if the patient could get the second shot on 30Mar2021. The patient was recovering from "Cough/bad cough/dry cough", "Stomach pain/top part of her stomach would hurt/stomach was hurting right at the bottom of her rib cage", and "O2 level was 82-86/ Oxygen level was like 84 or 86 so she was put on oxygen"; has recovered from "nauseated/felt sick to stomach" on an unspecified date. The outcome of the events "inflammation in the lower lungs that was rubbing on her diaphragm", pneumonia, "feeling bad", "ate about half of her breakfast, this lasted for several days, she wouldn't eat much", "feels like she doesn't have any energy", "gastroenteritis", "short of breath" and "she wasn't breathing deep" was unknown.; Sender's Comments: Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021329963 Same reporter, drug and event; different patient

head aches; chills; weird feeling on head; left hand from elbow to finger tips began to numb then few seconds right hand fingers began to numb, numbness to both hands; started feeling sweaty; shortness of breath; light headed; nausea; blood pressure drop to 40; The initial was missing the following minimum criteria: Unspecified AE. Upon receipt of follow-up information on 23Mar2021, this case now contains all required information to be considered valid. This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), first dose at the age of 59-years-old via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 05Jan2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EL1284) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included atrial fibrillation, thyroid problem, hearing problem from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing, Stroke like paralysis from 2014 to an unknown date, gallbladder removal in 2018. Concomitant medications included sotalol, taken for atrial fibrillation from Dec2019 and ongoing; levothyroxine taken for thyroid disorder from 2017 and ongoing; cyanocobalamin (B-12) taken for an unspecified indication from 2014 and ongoing; aspirin [acetylsalicylic acid], taken for an unspecified indication from 2014 and ongoing. The patient experienced 3-5 minutes after the first dose on 05Jan2021, started feeling sweaty, shortness of breath, light headed, nausea, numbness to both hands. Next day 06Jan2021, wake up with numbness to left hands, head aches, chills, weird feeling in head (back left side of head). This went on for about 2 weeks lasted 1 month got better as days went day. It was also reported that she experienced that her left hand from elbow to finger tips began to numb then few seconds right hand fingers began to numb for period of 2 weeks. Her blood pressure drop to 40 on 05Jan2021. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood pressure measurement: drop to 40 on 05Jan2021, sars-cov-2 antibody test: 0 (came out 0 antibodies on my blood work had never been expose to anyone with Covid 19) on 24Nov2019, sars-cov-2 test: negative on 08Jan2021. The patient also reported that on 05Jan2021, she received the dose and had a reaction to it, but that same day her mother was taken to the hospital because she wasn't breathing well and she came out positive to Covid, she passed away 14 days after the patient took a test on Covid 08Jan2021 tested negative. She don't know if it was soon to be tested but other family member tested positive. The patient did not receive treatment for the events and was hospitalized due to the events. The patient did not recover from nausea, headache, chills while the outcome of the other events was unknown.

nerve problems behind left eye; nerve problems in face; lips had nerve problems; tongue was numb; throat felt swollen; Bell's palsy; lightheaded and dizzy; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (who is also the patient). A 59-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EN6207), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm, on 11Mar2021 15:30, as single dose, for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included known allergies to antihistamine (unspecified) and sulfur drugs. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient did not have COVID-19 prior the vaccination and was not tested for COVID-19 post vaccination. Concomitant medications included levothyroxine sodium (SYNTHROID); omeprazole; and anastrozole, all taken for unspecified indications, start and stop dates were not reported. Historical vaccine included the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EN6200) received at age 59 years, via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm, on 18Feb2021 15:45, for COVID-19 immunization. The patient did not receive other vaccines in four weeks. On 11Mar2021 at 15:45, 15 minutes after the second dose, the patient got lightheaded and dizzy. On the same day at 16:15, 45 minutes after the second dose, the patient experienced nerve problems behind left eye, then nerve problems in face, then lips had nerve problems, then tongue was numb, and throat felt swollen. The patient reported the side effects on the hotline, and she was transferred to a nurse who told her to go to the emergency room immediately as she could be getting Bell's palsy from the vaccine. The events resulted to emergency room visit and hospitalization (unspecified date in Mar2021). Treatment for the events included unspecified IV. The patient was hooked up to an EKG and her blood was drawn for checking in Mar2021 (results were unknown). The patient was recovering from the events. Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.
59 2021-04-12 shortness of breath To summarize our conversation, you stated that you received the second Pfizer vaccine on 3/4/21. Th... Read more
Close
To summarize our conversation, you stated that you received the second Pfizer vaccine on 3/4/21. Three days later, on 3/7/21, you began to have fatigue, shortness of breath, dizziness and chest pressure. Because all symptoms continued for 24 hours, on the evening of 3/8/21, you took yourself to the Emergency Department. Your ER work-up included a CXR (negative), an EKG (showing a left bundle branch block), serum bloodwork (negative for MI), however, the D-dimer and spiral CT were both positive for a pulmonary emboli (i.e. a blood clot in your lungs). You were admitted to the hospital and started on the blood thinner, Eliquis. During your 3-day hospital stay, your work-up also included a bilateral lower extremity Doppler study (negative) and an echocardiogram (showing left ventricular hypertrophy). You were discharged on all of your previously prescribed medications (see list below), except for the fish oil. You were also started on Eliquis. Since discharge, you have followed up with your PCP and have been referred to a cardiologist and pulmonologist. To date, you have had no further symptoms. PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, pre-diabetes. PRE-VACCINE MEDICATIONS: losartan, HCTZ, amlodipine, Welchol, fenofibrate, fish oil. POST-ER VISIT MEDICATIONS: losartan, HCTZ, amlodipine, Welchol, fenofibrate, Eliquis.

Congestive heart failure; Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease; congestive heart failure and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease; Arm was killing her all the way down/her arm hurt so bad/ left leg hurts from her knee to her hip; Chills; Headache; Left leg hurts from her knee to her hip; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot Number: ENB207), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 19Mar2021 08:00 AM (at the age of 59-year-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma since 1990, obese since 1990, Congestive heart failure about 4 years ago in 2017, Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease since 1989; all were ongoing. She had a chemical exposure in a small town that started the COPD since about 1989. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received fluzone on unspecified date for flu vaccine and caused COPD exacerbation, she was given doxycycline and prednisone with that. The patient is calling about the Pfizer Covid 19, her first dose she received on 19Mar2021. She isn't going to take the second Covid 19 vaccine. On 19Mar2021 at 7:00PM on the day she received her Covid 19 vaccine her arm was killing her all the way down/ arm hurt so bad she wanted to cut it off. That lasted the whole next day and she took 2 Tylenol arthritis pills. Her arm was real sore the next day but it wasn't paining her like it was that first day. It was still a little sore but not like it was. The pain was down the whole arm. Last week (on unspecified date in Mar2021), she started getting headaches and chills. She'll get a chill and the chill will go away. Then a couple hours later the chills will come back. Her headache comes and goes. She checked her blood pressure and her blood pressure is normally low, she checked it and it was 117/76 in 2021. She knew her blood pressure wasn't causing her headaches. And she checked her oxygen level on unspecified date in 2021 and it was good. She normally does not have headaches. She's on 4L of oxygen because of congestive heart failure and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. Her breathing has been, she can't describe it. Her doctor prescribed some steroids yesterday, 30Mar2021. She is asking if this is normal after 2 weeks. When asking her about her breathing she reports it's like her chest is tighter and she has shortness of breath. If she moves, her oxygen level on unspecified date in 2021 drops with the slightest little movement. Her oxygen has been dropping into the 70s and she has to do the pursed lips breathing to recover. It's taking a while to recover. She has to really work to get her oxygen back into the 90s. That started last week some time. She did call her doctor and her doctor prescribed prednisone and doxycycline (Prednisone 4, 10 mg tablets for 3 days, then 3 tablets for 3 days, then 2 tablets for 3 days, then 1 tablet for 3 days and Doxycline Hyclate 100mg 1 capsule twice daily for 7 days). She forgot to mention that her left leg hurts from her knee to her hip on unspecified date in 2021. That started a couple days ago. She didn't have any problems with her hip before. She's scared because the second vaccine is more potent, it's worse. She doesn't know if she's going to get that second Covid 19 vaccine. The outcome of the events was not recovered.

she was in distress with her throat starting to swell, her tongue started to swell and she was covered with the hives and rash from head to toe.; her lips and tongue began to swell; her lips and tongue began to swell; rash on her palms, hands, elbows, and left hip/rash all over her body; elbows were red; hive rash on her palm and hand and elbows and it was strange and her elbows were red and were itchy on the palms like red and itchy; developed hives/rash on her palms, hands, elbows, and left hip; WBC count was high; liver was not doing great; post COVID vaccine delayed allergic reaction; pain in her right ear; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 59-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 22Feb2021 11:15 (Batch/Lot Number: EL9266) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included arrhythmia, ear infection. Concomitant medication(s) included propranolol (PROPANOLOL [PROPRANOLOL]) taken for arrhythmia from Apr2020 to an unspecified stop date. The patient previously took augmentin [amoxicillin;clavulanic acid] for ear pain and experienced rash on her elbows and palm and arm. Caller stated on Friday 05Mar2021, which was the 11th day after getting the Pfizer COVID Vaccine although she noticed symptoms on the 10th day 04Mar2021 after receiving the vaccine, states she noticed she had a hive rash on her palm and hand and elbows/rash on her palms, hands, elbows, and left hip and it was strange and her elbows were red and were itchy on the palms like red and itchy and she could see the rash starting on the left inside forearm; from there as the day wore on into the next day the rash became worse and more areas of the body were covered with the rash. States she made an appointment on that Monday morning with her HCP and had gone into the HCP office at that time; states on 08Mar2021, she was in distress with her throat starting to swell, her tongue started to swell/ her lips and tongue began to swell and she was covered with the hives and rash from head to toe. Caller states she was started on Prednisone at her HCP office and it was one of those dose packs; states she has no lot numbers to provide. Later on that evening she needed to go to the emergency room and she had become more severe and had a big dose of Prednisone at the emergency room and at that time the HCP there did believe she was having what is considered a post COVID vaccine delayed allergic reaction and hives; states she was in the emergency room early and was there past midnight and thinks she presented to the emergency room on 09Mar2021 and then most recent results she has of her paperwork were from 09Mar2021 to 10Mar2021; no further details provided by the caller. Caller states she was in the emergency room rolled over to the next day on the 09Mar in the evening around 10:30pm and concluded her ER visit on the 10Mar after 12:30. Caller states the HCP gave her the 40mg dose of Prednisone by injection and she has no lot number; states then at the ER, they gave her Prednisone 125mg IV and she has no lot number; they gave her hydroxyzine which is Atarax by IV and gave her Pepcid for her stomach at the same time; no lots for the Pepcid or Hydroxyzine. States the reason for her visit was allergic reaction, allergy hives, post covid delayed reaction. States she let them know at the site that before the vaccine she felt like she might have had an ear infection and was not taking anything no vitamins or anything like that and no Tylenol or anything for a week or so prior because she wanted nothing to be in her system other than the vaccine should anything happen. Had the vaccine that day, later on that afternoon contacted her HCP felt like she had ear infection, no fever but had fullness and some pain in her right ear. Saw her HCP at that time and took a look inside her ear and felt that she did have an ear infection without fever but was painful to the touch around her ear underneath her ear; prescribed Augmentin which she has taken before. Started taking one Augmentin pill on the 23rd in evening which would be Tues 23Feb2021 for the 1st dose, 500mg and dose supposed to take following the next day was to take two tablets one tablet twice per day which she did finish up around 10 days of that on 04Mar. The day before all this started with the rash she finished Augmentin, went to the HCP and two things happened; she was taking Augmentin and had the Pfizer COVID Vaccine. States she had the rash on her elbows and palm and arm and she was like that coincides with the Pfizer vaccine but also was on Augmentin and had been on that before with no problems; thought it was either the vaccine or being on the Augmentin as the reason for the rash but narrowed it to the vaccine. States she ended up in the hospital that evening on Monday evening of 09Mar and it was something they had not seen but were prepared to see could happen and concluded the rash was from the vaccine. Caller states she went to see her immunologist at the conclusion of this event and she was still covered in hives and rash and did step her down on the Prednisone and prescribed her hydroxyzine and topical itch stuff. Caller states she has no lot numbers to provide for the topical stuff or the hydroxyzine or Prednisone. States the HCP concluded she could not receive the 2nd dose of the Pfizer COVID Vaccine or any other vaccine that comes forward and she is not a candidate because of this reaction he can't safely say it would be ok to get a 2nd dose of the vaccine; states she can't receive a 2nd dose of any covid vaccine and it worried her because she has to be ok with having had the 1st dose of the vaccine and wants to know where she stands with that and what to do and she just doesn't know. States it is not she herself saying she can't get the 2nd dose of the covid vaccine but under her HCP advice and two ER visits and many doses of Prednisone and she presented how she looked and that prompted the HCP to say no 2nd dose for her. States she was taking Prednisone started two days of 50mg then 2 days of 40mg, then 30mg, then 20mg, then 10mg and that brought down the amount in her system; states she was given Hydroxyzine 1-2 tablets every 4 hours of 25mg and has no lot numbers for the Prednisone or Hydroxyzine. Caller states instead of taking Benadryl she was taking the topical stuff because Benadryl was not really working and she took Benadryl 25mg tablets in the beginning to try to get the itching out of her system and she felt really really tired and was so tired from taking the Benadryl; caller states she has no lot numbers to provide for the Benadryl. She was given a prescription for Hydroxyzine and the thinks it tended to work better and she did not take a drastic amount of it but it could cause drowsiness and she did feel a lot better from taking it but did not have a really bad feeling of feeling really dopey and sleepy with it because she felt bad enough and did not want to feel bad. States she kept on this for the 10 days or more of a 14 day course and was feeling like until it started to subside. On an unspecified date it was reported that Her WBC count was high and her "liver was not doing great" but recent bloodwork shows it has returned to normal. The patient was hospitalized for the events developed hives/rash on her palms, hands, elbows, and left hip, elbows were red, hive rash on her palm and hand and elbows and it was strange and her elbows were red and were itchy on the palms like red and itchy, her lips and tongue began to swell, WBC count was high, liver was not doing great, post COVID vaccine delayed allergic reaction. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included white blood cell count: returned to normal on an unspecified date, white blood cell count: high on Mar2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events except for WBC count high and liver was not doing great. The outcome of the events was unknown.

A 59-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), first dose via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the right arm on 11Apr2021 at 11:15 (batch/lot number: EP7533) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Facility type vaccine was health clinic. No other vaccine in four weeks. No Covid prior to vaccination and not Covid tested post vaccination. A nurse saw her in distress & caught her before she hit the floor. She then had difficulty breathing. They administered EpiPen, 50 mg liquid Benadryl & 2 puffs of Ventolin. to make sure there is no pulmonary embolism; Shaking legs and arms; Lightheaded; PVCs (Ventricular premature beat); Large black bruise on left breast; 40 hrs fever; throwing up/vomiting; nausea 36 hours; intermittent breathing issues/sporadic breathing issues/difficulty breathing and hard to get a breath; She was weak; severe migraine; Headache; Brain fog; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, lot number ER8727, expiration date: 31Jul2021), via an unspecified route of administration in arm left on 07Apr2021 12:00 as single dose for Covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included allergy ( macro Danton, sulfa). Patient was not pregnant at time of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient's concomitant medication included Nerontin. The patient reviously received flu vaccine and had normal things, previously received first dose of bnt162b2 (Lot Number: EN5318; Expiration Date: 31May2021) in arm left on 17Mar2021 16:00 and experienced acute lymphatic response, brain fog and arm started to hurt. The pateint was calling because her doctor, who she saw yesterday 14Apr2021, told her she should let Pfizer know what was going on. She had a reaction to the Pfizer Covid19 Vaccine. she was now having PVCs. The patient added that all of the events started with a fever, and throwing up. She had a fever and threw up for 36 hours. She had to contact her physician to get medication and to stop vomiting and the nausea and everything. During that time, she was sick. She was having intermittent breathing issues which she did not think she felt too much of until after the other sickness was over. She was weak, like people get after they are sick, and had bizarre shaking legs and arms which was strange. She added that she had breathing issues and difficulty breathing and hard to get a breath. That was what she was dealing with. Treatment: caller took Pedialyte and all the proper things to get back into better shape. The breathing issue still remained. The doctor called in a rescue inhaler. She kept going downhill so he called in a rescue inhaler. Large black bruise on left breast after second vaccine: Caller added that this one will not be believed but on Monday, she woke up and got dressed again and was just weak and had breathing issues but was just doing work on the laptop. She did not fall, she did not run into anything. In the evening, she went to take a bath and saw that when she took her clothes off there was a large black bruise on her left breast, it was probably 2 inches in diameter. It is very large, but does not hurt like a bruise. She checked the rest of her body for blood issues and only saw a couple normal looking bruises. She contacted her doctor, and they questioned her thoroughly on her bruising and activity. This was on Monday. Tuesday, she still felt the same headache, weak, and breathing issues. PVCs (Ventricular premature beat) after second vaccine: Yesterday, 14Apr2021, she started declining and the doctor wanted to see her. Caller stated the doctor heard PVCs in her heart. Caller asked clarification of PVC abbreviation and does not provide. She never had heart issues ever. The doctor did blood work and a chest x-ray, and saw the bruise and was worried about her blood. Caller added that even though these are not listed as side effects of the vaccine, she was worried. Her doctor sent her to a facility for chest x-rays to make sure there is no pulmonary embolism. Caller confirmed this was on 14Apr2021. She has not yet heard back. PVCs after second vaccine: Caller added the doctor said her lungs sounded good but wanted to see what was going on to see how her breathing was because there was difficulty. The doctor wanted to cover bases and check. Today, caller can tell her heart is still not in correct rhythm and that it is in continued PVCs. She still had the same breathing issues, limbs were weak, she was shaky, and she is lightheaded. She was hoping to wake up today and feel better. Fever after second vaccine: started 3am 08Apr2021. She had a fever and was throwing up at this time. Throwing up and nausea after second vaccine: caller add that throwing up and vomiting with nausea occurred at 3 am, all of this occurred 08APR2021. The vomiting lasted 36 hours, and it ended when she took medication. The fever lasted 40 hours. Even after the medication worked for her fever, she had nausea. Around Friday was when it went away. Intermittent breathing issues after second vaccine: caller adds it started with throwing up and fever, but she did not think a lot about this or know when it started because she was dealing with the fever and vomiting. It continued, and it has not subsided or ended. As a matter of fact, there are 2 or 3 times it has gotten bad which is why she was given an inhaler. Treatments: caller took a Phenergan suppository, which she adds is the best medicine in the World for nausea and beats Zofran. She had used two or three doses and it did work. She used a rescue inhaler, Albuterol Sulfate HFA. She took Tylenol for fever. She is also now taking an aspirin daily because of the blood issues. No additional information regarding the products. Weak after second vaccine: caller adds that this started at the same time, she was over the nausea and noticed this. It felt different than what it feels like with the flu. This is still going on, she did not think too much about it but it has persisted. Sometimes there is a little bit of shaking but that is intermittent. Caller states she can not put it into words. Bizarre shaking legs and arms after second vaccine: this goes with the weakness, she is continually weak but she has a shaky feeling that will come every now and then and is random. Large black bruise on left breast after second vaccine: Monday this started, 12APR2021 and it is still there but it is the same. It has not been sore like a bruise but it is black and large. The physician has seen it now and it is bizarre and scary. It is the left breast on the outside. Headache after second vaccine: started probably an hour after the vaccine, pretty quick. There were degrees to this headache because it was an actual migraine for a good 48 hours and even after the fever was gone it was terrible. It started out just a mild headache and then was very severe for a couple of days. Then, after that it was just there but not as severe. PVCs after second vaccine: caller adds that she went to the doctor yesterday 14APR2021 and she can tell every now and again that she is having these but there is nothing she can do about it. Caller adds this is everything new she can think of, but some of it is foggy, she thinks this is the main information. Brain fog after first and second vaccine: Caller then states, by the way, after both vaccines within 2 or 3 minutes of having them her head started feeling foggy and weird. Investigations: caller has not received any results yet. She did get an EKG, Chest XRAY, blood work, and the doctor also rattled off a bunch of things the doctor was going to check. These all were on 14Apr2021 and she is waiting on results. Caller confirms the physician told her she had PVCs while listening to caller's heart. Did any AE require a visit to: Physician office? 15Apr2021 she was in contact with her physician, and the whole week they were on the phone. Yesterday 14Apr2021 the physician wanted to see her. The doctor figured out something was going on with her heart so thankfully the doctor wanted to see her. It was discussed if caller should go to the ER but caller did everything she could not to go because that is the last place she wants to go. Emergency Room: no. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of fever, vomiting, nausea was recovered, intermittent breathing issues, shaking legs and arms, weak, severe migraine, headache was not recovered, for other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. acute lymphatic response/severe pain in lymph nodes, the ones around her ovaries/severe pain like cysts except both sides were hurting; had trouble catching breath with the pain; arm pain; brain fog/head started feeling foggy and weird; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer reporting for herself. A 59-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 17Mar2021 16:00 (Lot Number: EN5318, Expiry date: 31May2021) on left arm at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history and concomitant medications were reported as none. Historical Vaccine included flu shots. The patient stated her physician told her she had an acute lymphatic response. She added there was something about 3 am (18Mar2021) because she woke up at 3 am and had severe pain in some of her lymph nodes. In particular, the ones around her ovaries. She added that she was old and her ovaries had not worked in a long time. She had severe pain like cysts except both sides were hurting. She also had trouble catching breath with the pain. This lasted 45 minutes and subsided. The next morning 18Mar2021, when she got up some of her lymph nodes were very panful and there was one even that was a node visible down her throat almost at the base of her neck in the center. She could see it sticking out, it was crazy. It went down in about three days. The pain and the weirdness in all of her other lymph's was about 3 or 4 days. It was an odd response and people told her it was just her body acting like a young person and was going to work. This was the first issue she had with the vaccines. The patient also experienced brain fog after first vaccine on 17Mar2021: within 2 or 3 minutes of having them her head started feeling foggy and weird. It was after the first vaccine, she thought it was psychological but it did not go away and it was not psychological. It was like a weird foggy and like taking sinus medication, no additional details. When it happened with the first vaccine, it did not concern her as much as the first one. It went away after the first vaccine probably late that evening (17Mar2021), around 10:30 pm right when her arm started to hurt. She did not have arm pain that was severe. She added maybe it lasted a day. The next day it hurt but it was not anything bad, it just hurt to touch it and to lift it hurt for a day. Maybe this was for 36-40 hours before the pain went out. The outcome of event "trouble catching breath with the pain" was resolved on 18Mar2021 03:45, outcome of event "brain fog/head started feeling foggy and weird" was resolved on 17Mar2021, outcome of other events were resolved in Mar2021. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Cervical vertebra #8 through Lumbar vertebra #5 is very, very painful; in excruciating pain; muscle tenderness; muscle tightness; pain feels like someone kicked her in her kidneys; pain feels like it's punching her lungs; pain is a 10 plus in both flanks; back pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm right on 20Apr2021 08:26 (Lot Number: ER8732) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing asthma, ongoing hypertension, ongoing mitral valve prolapse, ongoing Tarlov cysts and ongoing mobility issues and problems standing and sitting. The patient had a neurological condition caused Tarlov Cysts. These cysts populated right outside of the dorsal root nerve system. In her, it's cervical vertebra #5 all the way down her spine bilaterally. In May2018, she had a surgical procedure, not an aspiration, for 8 of the nerves in her sacrum. She has had complications ever since. Cervical vertebra #7 and #8 have been giving her the most problems. Concomitant medications included ongoing oxycodone hydrochloride, oxycodone terephthalate, paracetamol (PERCOCET) 10mg every 4 hours taken for pain, and her doctor recently changed it; ketorolac tromethamine (TORADOL) injection and something for acid reflux but she did not think that's relevant. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 (lot number: EN6208) in arm right on 16Mar2021 9:48AM for COVID-19 immunisation at the age of 59-year-old and she had no problems just soreness in her arm. There were no Prior Vaccinations within 4 weeks. She had her second Covid 19 vaccine yesterday morning, 20Apr2021. Cervical vertebra #8 through Lumbar vertebra #5 was very, very painful from 20Apr2021. She didn't know or hasn't heard if the Covid 19 vaccine is associated with her back pain. This pain that she's having now didn't feel like the pain she had related to her Tarlov cysts. Before the Covid 19 vaccine she had no problems until late last night (20Apr2021) and early this morning (21Apr2021). She was in excruciating pain. She reported it's complicated for her to make that mind adjustment. She texted her cousin this morning at 6:30AM (21Apr2021) because she had to let her cousin know what was going on. If her cousin texts and she doesn't respond, her cousin will do a welfare check. She doesn't want a welfare check so she told her cousin to just let her sleep, let her see how she feels when she's up again. She reported sometimes when the Tarlov cysts were bothering her she could lay on her back and it would soothe her pain. This time that was not working. She reported she had her vertebra and her discs and then her outer muscular system to the flank, that is where it was painful. She didn't know if this is normal. She was hearing normal side effects like tiredness and fatigue, she was not having those because she was not normal. She was 1 in 2 billion with her Tarlov cysts. She has complications with her Tarlov cysts. She has mobility issues and problems standing and sitting. She has Tarlov cysts from Cervical vertebra #5 bilaterally down. She had multiple cysts. She didn't know if the Covid 19 vaccine was aggravating her back. She reported she has 2 nervous systems, her parasympathetic and her sympathetic nervous system. She reported this is in her parasympathetic nervous system. She reported sensory, if she touches something hot, she knew it was hot. She reported this is so important. She had muscle tenderness and muscle tightness from 20Apr2021and that's it. She knew what she was taking about because she was using medical terminology. The pain felt like someone kicked her in her kidneys. The kidneys, where the waist is on her back to the top of her sacral area and up the spine to where her first rib is and go outward, that's where her pain was, from thoracic vertebra 12 to lumbar 5. The only different thing she's done was get the Covid 19 vaccine. She was trying to triage herself. She didn't know what else to do. The Percocet was not even fixing it. She wanted to make sure the Covid 19 vaccine wasn't exacerbating her disease. She thought that's what's happening. She was in a lot of pain. Her pain was the same before and after when she took the Percocet. Normally the Percocet calmed her down to where she's functional and the Percocet was not. Percocet was 10-325mg, oxycodone and acetaminophen. Take one 4 times daily as needed for pain. The Percocet was a pharmacy bottle. In order for her to have a quality of life she also took Ketorolac or Toradol. She hadn't taken that today (21Apr2021). She picked her prescriptions up at the same time she received her Covid 19 vaccine. She can lay on the ground on her back sometimes and her pain will be alleviated. Now laying on her back exacerbates her pain. She didn't know if it's muscular. If she was diagnosing herself, she would say it's not muscular. She knew enough about Tarlov cysts that she knew how to rule it out. She reported her felt feels like it's punching her lungs. She reported it's so hard to explain. She's trying to separate the pain she has from her Tarlov cysts from what she's experiencing now. She reported her pain was a 10 plus in both flanks. She stated people will call flanks "the sides". The only reason she knows it's a flank is because she had learn anatomy real quick with her Tarlov cysts. On the date of her first Covid 19 vaccine she had a steroid injection and a Toradol injection. With her second Covid 19 vaccine she had a Toradol injection. The pharmacist told her there would be no conflict in receiving the Covid 19 vaccine. she has to suffer through it until her pain subsides. It feels like it's kicking the heck out of her back. When she lays supine she can alleviate some of the pain associated with the Tarlov cysts but that's not working. She can't stand or lay supine, all of that is out the window. Meaning it's not working. This pain has to be the Covid 19 vaccine. She's in a lot of pain and she didn't need the vaccine to exacerbate her pain. There were no vaccines administered on same date with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. The adverse events did not require a visit to Emergency Room or Physician Office. The outcome of events was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.
59 2021-05-09 painful respiration Day of shot within 1 hour Felt like my arm was dislocated for several days. Still feeling discomfort... Read more
Close
Day of shot within 1 hour Felt like my arm was dislocated for several days. Still feeling discomfort. Day 3 Extreme burning in lower jaw with pain also similar to toothache and all teeth and lower jaw. Eventually extended throughout my neck and lower part of my head. Inhaling felt like stabbing in lower neck and a three and four.
59 2021-05-09 shortness of breath I was hospitalized for bilateral pulmonary embolism 4/18/2021 at hospital. I think I had symptoms fo... Read more
Close
I was hospitalized for bilateral pulmonary embolism 4/18/2021 at hospital. I think I had symptoms for over 3 weeks prior to hospitalization. I was rapid COVID tested on 3/26/2021 the nurse at CVS asked why my blood oxygen was low. I did not know but had me pant and move my fingers and it went up to 96. I also remember severe leg pain on a drive 3/25/21. I noticed shortness of breath 4/5/21 and fast pulse but didnot go to hospital until 4/18/21. I previously had a PE 7/2009 and also had it for ~2 weeks before going to hospital. I was not on blood thinner since 2015. The doctors at the hospital and primary care doctor did not seem to think the PE was vaccine related but they also do not believe I had symptoms for over 3 weeks.
59 2021-05-09 respiratory distress o ED Course Medical decision making arrival to ED 5:54 am on 5/10/21 Patient with altered mental s... Read more
Close
o ED Course Medical decision making arrival to ED 5:54 am on 5/10/21 Patient with altered mental status from an unknown cause. Her pupils were dilated and slow to react and she was in some respiratory distress and very diaphoretic. At this point airway was controlled 5 oh endotracheal intubation using the glide scope and during the intubation patient was noted for copious amounts of dark brown vomitus coming from her esophagus which was guaiac positive. Her blood pressure was low she was sedated initially with propofol etomidate was used for the intubation however because of her hypotension the propofol was slowed and she was given Versed which did seem to control her agitation and maintain her blood pressure. Patient had IV fluid initiated wide open and CT scan was obtained of head chest abdomen pelvis given the fact that her altered mental status could be from some kind of intracerebral catastrophe and the patient's abdominal exam being unobtainable certainly possible that her GI bleeding could be from a perforated viscus. CT scan of the brain does not demonstrate any stroke that appears to be acute however there may be some ischemia present although it may be remote and an MRI will need to be done when the patient is more stable. CT of the chest abdomen pelvis shows what is likely an aspiration pneumonia on the right as well as a perforated viscus in her abdomen. Radiology feels is probably somewhere in the right colon terminal ileum. At this point the patient was given Cipro and Flagyl and that should also aid with her aspiration pneumonia. Her blood pressure did start to decrease her temperature was noted to be elevated at 101.8. She was given Tylenol rectally and fluids were allowed to run wide open. Her blood pressure continued to decline and Levophed was instituted. Case was discussed in detail with surgery and she will go to the OR immediately. Her temperature continued to rise and was 104.5 upon transfer to the operating room as blood pressure was 78 systolic ED COURSE: o ED Course Medical decision making Patient with altered mental status from an unknown cause. Her pupils were dilated and slow to react and she was in some respiratory distress and very diaphoretic. At this point airway was controlled 5 oh endotracheal intubation using the glide scope and during the intubation patient was noted for copious amounts of dark brown vomitus coming from her esophagus which was guaiac positive. Her blood pressure was low she was sedated initially with propofol etomidate was used for the intubation however because of her hypotension the propofol was slowed and she was given Versed which did seem to control her agitation and maintain her blood pressure. Patient had IV fluid initiated wide open and CT scan was obtained of head chest abdomen pelvis given the fact that her altered mental status could be from some kind of intracerebral catastrophe and the patient's abdominal exam being unobtainable certainly possible that her GI bleeding could be from a perforated viscus. CT scan of the brain does not demonstrate any stroke that appears to be acute however there may be some ischemia present although it may be remote and an MRI will need to be done when the patient is more stable. CT of the chest abdomen pelvis shows what is likely an aspiration pneumonia on the right as well as a perforated viscus in her abdomen. Radiology feels is probably somewhere in the right colon terminal ileum. At this point the patient was given Cipro and Flagyl and that should also aid with her aspiration pneumonia. Her blood pressure did start to decrease her temperature was noted to be elevated at 101.8. She was given Tylenol rectally and fluids were allowed to run wide open. Her blood pressure continued to decline and Levophed was instituted. Case was discussed in detail with surgery and she will go to the OR immediately. Her temperature continued to rise and was 104.5 upon transfer to the operating room as blood pressure was 78 systolic CRITICAL CARE: o Critical Care Indication patient was critically ill... o Critical Care Indication Patient was critically ill with a high probability of imminent or life threatening deterioration. o Critical Care Time Spent 75-104 minutes (1 hour 15 minutes-1 hour 44 minutes) 2 hours and 50 minutes ED WORKING DIAGNOSIS: Perforated abdominal viscus (R19.8): Status: Active Septic shock (A41.9): Status: Active DISCHARGE/ADMISSION/TRANSFER DISPOSITION: o Disposition admitted o Admit To To OR CONDITION ON DISCHARGE/ADMISSION/TRANSFER: o Condition Critical Date of OR Procedure o Date of Procedure 05/10/2021 10:01 Pre Op Dx, Post Op Dx, Procedure o Pre Operative Diagnosis: Perforated viscus o Post Operative Diagnosis: Ischemic bowel, most likely from shower emboli. Most of the small intestine and large intestine was affected. o Procedure: Exploratory laparotomy, ICG injection for evaluation of perfusion Indication and Consent Findings: . Findings: Even after the ICG injection. There was spotty tissue necrosis from mid jejunum all the way through sigmoid colon. Most areas were blackened with a foul smell. There was some highlighted areas secondary to the ICG but not a significant amount that would lend for an anastomosis. Black ascites was present throughout the abdomen. Unfortunately after much contemplation there was no surgical intervention. Procedure Procedure: Patient was placed in supine position. Was intubated in the emergency room so, we were able to proceed with resuscitation through our anesthesia team. Patient's abdomen was prepped and draped in usual fashion. Proceeded to make a midline incision. The blood supply in the subcutaneous tissues did not even bleed. Appeared to be darkened and almost coagulated. As we entered through the fascia we were able to open the peritoneum between 2 hemostats. The large rush of free air through from the abdomen. We then proceeded to open the abdomen for the length of her incision. This was done with electrocautery. From here there was a black ascites present within the abdomen. There was a large amount of dead intestine that we could immediately see. I worked my way to the ligament of Treitz. There was no adhesions so this was easily found. That intestine did appear to be pink. It lasted for about a foot. After that area everything was either black or purple in color with a few pink spots in between. This went all the way down to the terminal ileum where pneumatosis was visualized. We then looked at the colon from cecum through rectum. It appeared to be blackened as well. Not knowing whether all of this intestine was dead or not especially with patient being hypotensive I injected ICG dye approximately 2 cc. This was to evaluate perfusion. Unfortunately perfusion was no better than what I could visualize. I could not even find enough room of the colon or small intestine to make an anastomosis. Was very hard decision, however, we did not resect any bowel. I closed the patient's abdomen. Patient will be taken to ICU on ventilator. Discussed with daughter with pastor present.
